content: Posting Light Today Moz News By: Rand Fishkin June 29, 2005 The author's views are entirely their own (excluding the unlikely event of hypnosis) and may not always reflect the views of Moz. Table of Contents Copied! By: Rand Fishkin June 29, 2005 Posting Light Today Moz News The author's views are entirely their own (excluding the unlikely event of hypnosis) and may not always reflect the views of Moz. Due to my work schedule being overwhelmingly busy today, I won't be posting much. I feel bad about this, since my loyal readers - you - have been kind enough to drop by. There are a few interesting things taking place in the SEO world that are worth reading about: Kim Krause-Berg is talking about design vs. substance and articles from Mike Grehan & Jeffrey Zeldman John Battelle has a classic communique between Google and the owner of a popular video they'd like to feature in Google video. Barry & many others are talking about Yahoo!'s new personalized community search Google's announced an API for maps - that should be fun. There's a long, interesting discussion at TW over MSN vs. Google Xan Porter's got a good post on the subject of MSN's Neural Net SEW Forums has two good topics - one on the futility of document topic analysis and the other on the Black Hat v. White Hat debate. Copied! Back to Top
